sect1.title: capture

row.entry: The name of the captured block
The variable name where to assign the captured output to

sect1.para: capture is used to collect the output of the template into a variable instead of displaying it. Any content between {capture name="foo"} and {/capture} is collected into the variable specified in the name attribute. The captured content can be used in the template from the special variable $smarty.capture.foo where foo is the value passed in the name attribute. If you do not supply a name attribute, then "default" will be used. All {capture} commands must be paired with {/capture}. You can nest capture commands.

note.title: Technical Note
note.para: Smarty 1.4.0 - 1.4.4 placed the captured content into the variable named $return. As of 1.4.5, this behavior was changed to use the name attribute, so update your templates accordingly.

caution.para: Be careful when capturing insert output. If you have caching turned on and you have insert commands that you expect to run within cached content, do not capture this content.
